alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 4:11AM PST until March 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 feet above 8500 feet, and 1 to 2 feet between 7500 and 8500 feet including Mammoth Lakes and June Lakes. Up to 6 inches down to 6500 feet if snow levels fall further than anticipated. Winds could gust as high as 120 mph along the Sierra Crest with up to 60 mph gusts along wind prone areas of the US-395 corridor. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds combined with heavy snow could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will drop to around 6500 to 7000 feet tonight into Saturday. Higher snow levels through Sunday brings the risk of flooding in lower elevations. See the Flood Advisory for more details. In addition, there is the potential for damaging winds along the Highway 395 corridor into this evening.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
